snippet: Several roving parties that represent people with mental illnesses are expressing their creativity and “claiming our place symbolically, socially and politically in society.”
abstract: Rio de Janeiro Journal; Carnival block, or roving street party, called Ta Pirando Pirado, Pirou! consists of Brazilian psychiatric patients and their doctors, therapists, family members and friends; group aims to give creative expression to those struggling with mental maladies and to demystify their illnesses for onlookers.

byline.original: By NADIA SUSSMAN and TAYLOR BARNES

lead_paragraph: Several roving parties that represent people with mental illnesses are expressing their creativity and “claiming our place symbolically, socially and politically in society.”

headline.main: At Carnival, Where Challenging Normal Is the Norm
headline.print_headline: At Carnival, Where Challenging Normal Is the Norm
